info.description: Auto-generated OpenAPI specification from live API responses
info.title: UMA API - Generated

checks.name: Array State
checks.remediation: Start the array from Unraid web interface

checks.name: Disk Health (sdb)
checks.remediation: Check disk SMART attributes and consider replacement

checks.name: Disk Health (md1p1)
checks.remediation: Check disk SMART attributes and consider replacement

checks.name: Disk Health (md2p1)
checks.remediation: Check disk SMART attributes and consider replacement

checks.name: Disk Health (md3p1)
checks.remediation: Check disk SMART attributes and consider replacement

checks.name: Disk Health (md4p1)
checks.remediation: Check disk SMART attributes and consider replacement

checks.name: Docker Service
checks.remediation: Start Docker service: systemctl start docker

checks.message: No recent critical errors in logs
checks.name: System Logs

checks.message: SSH root login may be enabled
checks.name: SSH Security
checks.remediation: Consider disabling SSH root login for security

example.description: Clear old system logs to free up space
example.name: clear_system_logs

example.description: Restart Docker service to resolve container issues
example.name: restart_docker

example.description: Clean up Docker images and containers
example.name: clear_docker_cache

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Jackett](https://github.com/Jackett/Jackett) works as a proxy server: it translates queries from apps (Sonarr, SickRage, CouchPotato, Mylar, etc) into tracker-site-specific http queries, parses the html response, then sends results back to the requesting software. This allows for getting recent uploads (like RSS) and performing searches. Jackett is a single repository of maintained indexer scraping & translation logic - removing the burden from other apps.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: e3c734600bf7f081ce357dbda29668fb3f975922
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Jackett

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Sonarr](https://sonarr.tv/) (formerly NZBdrone) is a PVR for usenet and bittorrent users. It can monitor multiple RSS feeds for new episodes of your favorite shows and will grab, sort and rename them. It can also be configured to automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: 9fd50e19407a4f6a62ccddc284cda66f06dd8535
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Sonarr

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Code-server](https://coder.com) is VS Code running on a remote server, accessible through the browser.  - Code on your Chromebook, tablet, and laptop with a consistent dev environment.  - If you have a Windows or Mac workstation, more easily develop for Linux.  - Take advantage of large cloud servers to speed up tests, compilations, downloads, and more.  - Preserve battery life when you're on the go.  - All intensive computation runs on your server.  - You're no longer running excess instances of Chrome.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: e204bcaef6049950a532da3cadf14a4b77df10d6
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Code-server

labels.io.hass.base.name: python
labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: Open-source home automation platform running on Python 3
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Home Assistant

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: The [Qbittorrent](https://www.qbittorrent.org/) project aims to provide an open-source software alternative to µTorrent. qBittorrent is based on the Qt toolkit and libtorrent-rasterbar library.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: d78e0089757031c68aa698d9105b005d5145ca2b
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Qbittorrent

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Radarr](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr) - A fork of Sonarr to work with movies à la Couchpotato.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: a587df8e84bbd3a06dff6442ae174f6cc334a2e5
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Radarr

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: Proxy server to bypass Cloudflare protection
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: FlareSolverr

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Sabnzbd](http://sabnzbd.org/) makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: 98de5e6f718b7f1cb583ce0a427439b733ce815d
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Sabnzbd

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Overseerr](https://overseerr.dev/) is a request management and media discovery tool built to work with your existing Plex ecosystem.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: 8594a9686a6cbe2a16a747c7f3694518603556af
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Overseerr

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: [Plex](https://plex.tv) organizes video, music and photos from personal media libraries and streams them to smart TVs, streaming boxes and mobile devices. This container is packaged as a standalone Plex Media Server. Straightforward design and bulk actions mean getting things done faster.
labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: c27d92587e0512513ad826a4ebde8a2cd1a5dd15
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: Plex

labels.org.opencontainers.image.description: Automatically sync TRaSH Guides to your Sonarr and Radarr instances
labels.org.opencontainers.image.title: recyclarr

response_time_ms.description: Health check response time in milliseconds

has_more.description: Whether there are more pages available

info.description: Unraid Management Agent API for system monitoring, Docker container management, VM control, and storage management
info.title: UMA API

get.description: Returns a list of Docker containers with optional pagination support

parameters.description: Page number for pagination (enables paginated response)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of items per page (enables paginated response)
parameters.name: limit

oneOf.description: Paginated response (when page or limit parameters are provided)
Legacy response format (when no pagination parameters)

post.description: Starts multiple Docker containers in a single bulk operation

container_ids.description: Array of container IDs or names to start
example: plex
nginx
sonarr

200.description: Bulk operation completed (may include partial failures)

get.description: Returns comprehensive health information including dependency status, system metrics, and performance data
Returns comprehensive disk information including SMART health data, with optional pagination support

parameters.description: Page number for pagination (enables paginated response with flattened disk list)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of disks per page (enables paginated response)
parameters.name: limit

oneOf.description: Paginated response (when page or limit parameters are provided)
Structured response format (when no pagination parameters)

get.description: WebSocket endpoint for real-time Docker container events (start, stop, restart, health changes)
WebSocket endpoint for real-time storage array status updates (disk health, SMART alerts, array status changes)
WebSocket endpoint for real-time system statistics including CPU, memory, and uptime

scripts.description: This script will delete all .DS_Store files on your array created by Apple's Finder
scripts.name: delete.ds_store

scripts.description: This simple script will delete any "dangling" images within your docker.img file
scripts.name: delete_dangling_images

scripts.description: This script will display the size of your docker logs, so you can see if runaway logging is contributing to your docker.img file filling up
scripts.name: viewDockerLogSize
